FH gene: FH stands for Factor H, a gene that provides instructions for making a protein involved in the regulation of the complement system, which plays a crucial role in the immune response against infections. A deficiency or mutation in this gene can lead to various diseases, including atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (aHUS) and membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis (MPGN).
